bill_title: limit the application of capital punishment.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to limit the application of capital punishment. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That chapter 23A-7A be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: Notwithstanding any other provisions of this chapter, no judge may impose the death penalty against any defendant if: (1) The defendant was less than twenty-one years of age at the time when the offense occurred; or (2) The defendant was developmentally disabled within the meaning of § 27B-1-3 at the time when the offense occurred. 750 copies of this document were printed by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.016 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.

FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to limit the application of capital punishment. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That chapter 23A-7A be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: Notwithstanding any other provisions of this chapter, no judge may impose the death penalty against any defendant if: (1) The defendant was less than sixteen years of age at the time when the offense occurred; or (2) The defendant was mentally retarded within the meaning of § 27B-1-1 at the time when the offense occurred. BILL HISTORY 1/28/99 First read in Senate and referred to Judiciary. S.J. 232 2/3/99 Scheduled for Committee hearing on this date. 2/3/99 Judiciary Do Pass Amended, Passed, AYES 5, NAYS 2. S.J. 314

FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to limit the application of capital punishment. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That chapter 23A-27A be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: Notwithstanding any other provisions of this chapter, no judge may impose the death penalty against any defendant if: (1) The defendant was less than sixteen years of age at the time when the offense occurred; or (2) The defendant was mentally retarded at the time the offense occurred. For the purposes of this section, the term, mentally retarded, includes any person with significant subaverage general intellectual functioning and deficits in adaptive behavior. BILL HISTORY 1/28/99 First read in Senate and referred to Judiciary. S.J. 232 2/3/99 Scheduled for Committee hearing on this date. 2/3/99 Judiciary Do Pass Amended, Passed, AYES 5, NAYS 2. S.J. 314 2/5/99 Senate Deferred to another day. S.J. 358 2/8/99 Deferred with pending amendment (Rule 5-17). S.J. 378 2/10/99 Motion to Amend, Passed. S.J. 426 2/10/99 Senate Do Pass Amended, Passed, AYES 25, NAYS 10. S.J. 426
